problem.markdown:
>>In a polar feedback loop, high temperatures lead to melting sea ice, which in turn results in:<< () evaporation into more clouds, cooling the planet () evaporation into more clouds, warming the planet () increased albedo in water surface, cooling the planet (x) decreased water surface albedo, warming the planet
[explanation] More melting of sea ice leads to an increase in sea level, leading to a lower water surface albedo (water is less reflective than ice), leading to warmer oceans and thus a warmer ocean atmosphere and ultimately a warmer planet. [explanation]
